answer_variants: A mutual fund pools money from many investors to buy a diversified portfolio of stocks, bonds or other assets. It's managed by professionals and gives small investors access to diversified portfolios.
Mutual funds let many investors combine their money and share the returns and risks of a professionally managed set of investments.
Compound interest is interest earned on both the original principal and on interest previously added. Over time, compound interest accelerates growth compared with simple interest.
When interest is reinvested, future interest earns interest too â€” that's compound interest, and it leads to exponential growth over long periods.
An EMI (Equated Monthly Installment) is a fixed monthly payment comprising principal and interest used to repay a loan over a set tenure.
EMI is the monthly amount you pay to repay a loan, calculated so payments are equal each month across the loan term.
